snippet: After early voting with lengthy waits and a slow count of absentee ballots, Florida election officials grappled with what went wrong when a record number of voters tried to cast a ballot.
abstract: Florida, after days of counting absentee ballots, officially declares Pres Obama winner; he takes 50 percent of vote compared with Mitt Romney's 49.1 percent, narrow difference of about 74,000 votes; record number of 8.4 million voters, or 70 percent of those registered, cast ballots.
lead_paragraph: After early voting with lengthy waits and a slow count of absentee ballots, Florida election officials grappled with what went wrong when a record number of voters tried to cast a ballot.

headline.seo: Florida to Address Delays as It Confirms Obama Victory
headline.main: Vote Count Confirms Obama Win in Florida
headline.print_headline: Obama Win Is Confirmed In Florida
